Description: Create stack for GenAI Samples Demo

LatestAmiId.Description: Use an AMI of your choosing, we recommend to use the latest available

CognitoDomain.Description: Enter a string in lowercase. Must be alpha (lowercase) numeric 3-63 in length and should not have 'cognito'.

AdditionalUserAttributesForSignup.Description: Additional Attributes required during user registration with Cognito

EnvPrefix.Description: Unique identifier to distinguish between envs

GenAICodeBootstrapBucketName.Description: S3 Bucket containing the Gen AI code samples and related artifacts for bootstrap, customizing and running the ECS containers for the sample application. This would be used to bootstrap and create the docker image if no public repo hosting the code samples is available/reachable.

JumpStartModelEndpointId.Description: Endpoint for a given model id (NOP - Jumpstart wont be deployed)

BedrockModelTypes.Description: preferred bedrock model type - order should match with corresponding BedrockModelIds

BedrockModelIDs.Description: preferred bedrock model ids, make sure the order matches the BedrockModelTypes and without space

JumpStartModelId.Description: Jumpstart model id (only if Jumpstart is indicated as preferred over Bedrock)

StableDiffusionDeployment.Description: Deploy StableDiffusion Model (only if Jumpstart is indicated as preferred over Bedrock)

PreferenceForModelType.Description: Prefer Bedrock for running code samples. Deployment of Jumpstart model currently disabled.

StableDiffusionModelEndpointId.Description: Endpoint for a given StableDiffusion model id

ContainerPort.Description: Port number where the service is running

ContainerCpu.Description: How much CPU to give the container ()1024 is 1 CPU)

ContainerMemory.Description: How much memory (in MB) to give the container

DesiredCount.Description: Copies of the service task to run.

S3BucketCleanupLambdaS3Key.Description: The name of the S3 Bucket Cleanup Lambda ZIP package (dont change)

SMDeployerLambdaS3Key.Description: The name of the Sagemaker Deployer Lambda ZIP package (dont change)

GenAISampleECRRepo.Description: ECR Repo name hosting the Gen AI sample container images (can be edited)

GenAISampleDockerImagePrefix.Description: ECR Repo name hosting the Gen AI sample container images (can be edited)

GenAISampleDockerVersion.Description: Default version of Gen AI sample container image (can be edited)

Properties.Description: Invoke a Lambda function to cleanup S3 bucket contents.
Invoke a Lambda function to validate email signups.

Code.ZipFile:
import os

aws_region = os.environ.get('AWS_REGION')
allowedDomains = os.environ.get('ALLOWED_DOMAINS').split(',')

def lambda_handler(event, context):

  event['response']['autoConfirmUser'] = False
  emailAddr = event['request']['userAttributes']['email'].split('@')
  userEmailDomain = emailAddr[1]
  if userEmailDomain in allowedDomains:
    event['response']['autoConfirmUser'] = True
    return event
  
  raise Exception("Invalid email domain")

Comment.Fn::Sub: CloudFront distribution for GenAI samples stack ${AWS::StackName}

Properties.Description: Ingress from other containers in the same security group

Properties.GroupDescription: Access to the public facing load balancer

Properties.Description: Invoke a Lambda function to terminate ec2 instances.

Code.ZipFile:
import json
import boto3
from pprint import pprint
import os
import urllib3

aws_region = os.environ.get('AWS_REGION')
ec2 = boto3.client('ec2', region_name=aws_region)


def generate_physical_resource_id(event, context):
    aws_account_id = context.invoked_function_arn.split(":")[4]

    props = event['ResourceProperties']
    instanceid = props['EC2InstanceIds'][0]
    

    return f'arn:aws:test:{aws_region}:{aws_account_id}:ec2/{instanceid}'
    
def lambda_handler(event, context):
    #pprint(dict(os.environ), width = 1)
    print('Incoming event for ec2 shutdown: ',event)
    instances = event['ResourceProperties']['EC2InstanceIds']
    ec2.terminate_instances(InstanceIds=instances)
    print('stopped your instances: ' + str(instances))
    sendResponse(event, context, 'SUCCESS', 'Termination Complete!!')

def sendResponse(event, context, responseStatus, responseData):

    responseBody = {
        'Status': responseStatus,
        'StackId': event['StackId'],
        'RequestId': event['RequestId'],
        'LogicalResourceId': event['LogicalResourceId'],
        'PhysicalResourceId': generate_physical_resource_id(event, context),
        'Data': { 'message': responseData }
    }

    if ('FAILED' == responseStatus):
        responseBody['Reason'] = responseData
        del responseBody['Data']

    print("RESPONSE BODY:\n", responseBody)

    json_response_body = json.dumps(responseBody)
    print("SENDING RESPONSE.. {} to {} ".format(json_response_body, event['ResponseURL']))

    headers = {
        'content-type' : '',
        'content-length' : str(len(json_response_body))
    }

    try:
        http = urllib3.PoolManager()
        response = http.request('PUT', event['ResponseURL'], headers=headers, body=json_response_body)
        print("Status code:", response.status)

    except Exception as e:
        print("send(..) failed executing http.request(..):", e)

GenAICodeBootstrapBucket.Description: S3 Bucket containing the Gen AI code samples and related artifacts for bootstrap, customizing and running the ECS containers for the sample application. This would be used to bootstrap and create the docker image if no public repo hosting the code samples is available/reachable.

GenAITestS3Bucket.Description: S3 Bucket for storing the various results (image/voice/text) of testing the use cases

GenAISearchInterpreterS3Bucket.Description: S3 Bucket containing the example inputs for search interpreter use case. Extract and upload the documents into the same S3 bucket and then sync the preconfigured Kendra index against its S3Datasource (configured to read from this bucket)

KendraIndex.Description: Kendra index for ingesting samples from S3 datasource

ECSCluster.Description: ECS Cluster name hosting the container running the streamlit application

ECSService.Description: ECS Service name hosting the container running the streamlit application

LBRSecureTokenHeader.Description: Token required for communicating with LoadBalancer directly (with 'X-Custom-Header' )

DockerCreationDebugLogsS3Bucket.Description: S3 bucket where debug logs for docker container creation gets stored (under debuglogs-*)
